title: Tracking issue for `soft_unstable` compatibility lint

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: T-lang
labels.description: Relevant to the language team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
#### What is this lint about

When some feature is unstable, but was allowed on stable due to some stability checking hole or oversight we may unstabilize it in a "soft" way to avoid breaking crates depending on the crates using the feature.

This soft unstabilization can be done using this lint.

#### How to fix this warning/error

Remove or `cfg`-out uses of the unstable feature in configurations of your code that are supposed to build on stable.

#### Current status
- https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/64066 uses `soft_unstable` for the attribute `#[bench]` (`feature(test)`).
- https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/79003 uses `soft_unstable` for inner `#![test]` (`feature(custom_inner_attributes)`).
- https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/82399 uses `soft_unstable` for inner `#![rustfmt::skip]` on out-of-line modules (`feature(custom_inner_attributes)`).
